items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River levels have receded overnight and will continue to recede today, however lake levels will remain high due to yesterdayâ€™s heavy rain. The forecast for a dry and sunny day means levels will continue to recede until tomorrow (Sunday) when further rain is forecast and levels will rise again for a time.  For today, Derwent Water will remain high affecting low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water.  Areas most at risk are the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. We continue to monitor levels closely and are clearing debris from weed screens in the area. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated tomorrow morning 09/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

River and lake levels remain high following a response to heavy rain yesterday. River levels have receded overnight and will continue to fall during today.  Lake levels are receding slowly but remain high and will continue to remain high during today and overnight.  A dry and sunny forecast today will mean river and lake levels will continue to fall.  Further rain is forecast for tomorrow (Sunday) which will increase levels on rivers and the lakes again for a time. For today, Derwent Water remains high affecting low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. We continue to monitor levels closely and are clearing debris from weed screens in the area. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated tomorrow morning 09/10/2022 or as the situation changes.
